Source   Edit  

Efficient BitSet implementation for lookahead sets in LALR(1) parser generation. Provides O(1) set operations using bitwise operations on uint64 words.

Imports

rules

Types

BitSet = object
  words*: seq[uint64]
  capacity*: int
Compact bitset for representing sets of terminal symbols. Uses sequint64 to support arbitrary number of terminals. Source   Edit   
SymbolContext = object
  terminalCount*: int
  externalCount*: int
  maxIndex*: int
Context for mapping symbols to/from BitSet indices. Source   Edit

    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert a dense integer back to a GrammarSymbol. Inverse of symbolToInt. Source   Edit   
proc len(bs: BitSet): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return the number of set bits (cardinality). Source   Edit   
proc newBitSet(capacity: int): BitSet {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a new empty BitSet that can hold capacity bits. Source   Edit

    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a symbol context for proper mapping. Source   Edit   
proc symbolToBit(ctx: SymbolContext; sym: GrammarSymbol): int {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert symbol to bit index using context. Source   Edit   
proc symbolToInt(sym: GrammarSymbol): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert a GrammarSymbol to a dense integer for BitSet indexing. Mapping: Terminals -> 0..N-1, Externals -> N..N+M-1, End -> N+M Source   Edit   
proc union(dest: var BitSet; src: BitSet): bool {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Union src into dest using bitwise OR. Returns true if dest was modified. Source   Edit
